name: bubble
description: A straightforward sorting algorithm that repeatedly compares and swaps adjacent elements if they are out of order, gradually moving larger values to the end.

name: insertion
description: An efficient sorting algorithm for small datasets that builds a sorted array one element at a time by inserting each new value into its correct position.

name: selection
description: A sorting algorithm that repeatedly finds the smallest remaining element in the unsorted portion and swaps it with the first unsorted position.

name: quick
description: A fast divide-and-conquer sorting algorithm that selects a pivot, partitions the array into smaller and larger elements, and recursively sorts each part.

name: merge
description: A stable, divide-and-conquer sorting algorithm that recursively splits an array into smaller subarrays, sorts them, and merges the sorted parts back together.

name: radix
description: A non-comparative sorting algorithm that processes numbers digit by digit, grouping them based on their individual place values.
